materials.raw_text:
Ozone (O3) - 0.1 g 
 Phosphoric Acid (H3PO4) - 1.0 g 
 Sodium Chloride (NaCl) - 24.0 g

sourcing.instructions:
Ozone can be generated using an ozone generator or purchased from specialized suppliers. 
 Phosphoric Acid can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online suppliers. 
 Sodium Chloride is commonly available at grocery stores or pharmacies.
steps: Ozone can be generated using an ozone generator or purchased from specialized suppliers.
Phosphoric Acid can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online suppliers.
Sodium Chloride is commonly available at grocery stores or pharmacies.
1. In a well-ventilated area, use an ozone generator to create 0.1 g of ozone.
2. In a glass container, carefully measure out 1.0 g of phosphoric acid.
3. Add 24.0 g of sodium chloride to the container with phosphoric acid.
4. Slowly introduce the ozone into the mixture while stirring gently to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text:
1. In a well-ventilated area, use an ozone generator to create 0.1 g of ozone. 
 2. In a glass container, carefully measure out 1.0 g of phosphoric acid. 
 3. Add 24.0 g of sodium chloride to the container with phosphoric acid. 
 4. Slowly introduce the ozone into the mixture while stirring gently to ensure even distribution.

cooling.raw_text: Remove the mixture from heat and allow it to cool at room temperature for 1 hour or until it reaches ambient temperature.

steps: Pour the cooled mixture into a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. Allow to cure for 24 hours at room temperature. After curing, carefully remove the solid from the mold and sand down any rough edges to achieve a smooth finish.
